message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.Distributed, cs.OS 

Reasoning: 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): The paper discusses the security guarantees of containers and introduces SGX as an alternative for secure execution of code in the cloud. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper focuses on container orchestration in heterogeneous clusters and evaluates the performance trade-offs of SGX-enabled micro-services in the cloud. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper presents contributions across the whole stack supporting execution of SGX-enabled containers, including the architecture of the scheduler and its monitoring framework, the underlying operating system support, and the required kernel driver extensions. 
- cs.Distributed: The paper discusses container orchestration in distributed environments and evaluates the performance trade-offs of SGX-enabled micro-services in the cloud. 
- cs.OS (Operating Systems): The paper presents details regarding the underlying operating system support and the required kernel driver extensions for SGX-enabled containers.
